intro: Onosma frutescens, commonly known as Persian stick or wild thyme, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb characterized by its aromatic, hairy leaves and small, yellowish or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae, which includes other plants with similar medicinal and ornamental uses. Onosma frutescens is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and antiseptic properties.
